name: Bright Minds Support
shortDescription: Specialized support for children with dyslexia
longDescription: We provide comprehensive dyslexia assessment and intervention programs tailored to each child's needs. Our multisensory approach helps children build reading confidence through structured literacy programs, Orton-Gillingham techniques, and assistive technology training.

name: Focus Learning Center
longDescription: Our certified coaches help children with ADHD develop organizational skills, focus techniques, and behavioral strategies to succeed academically and socially. We offer one-on-one coaching, parent training, and school collaboration services.

name: Speech & Language Hub
longDescription: We offer evidence-based speech and language therapy for children with articulation disorders, language delays, and communication challenges. Our services include assessment, individual therapy, group sessions, and parent training programs.

name: Autism Support Network
longDescription: We provide ABA therapy, social skills training, sensory integration therapy, and family support for children with autism spectrum disorders. Our team includes board-certified behavior analysts, occupational therapists, and special educators.

name: Learning Differences Institute
longDescription: We specialize in helping children with dyscalculia and other math learning difficulties through multisensory math instruction, cognitive strategy training, and adaptive teaching methods. Our programs build number sense and mathematical reasoning skills.

name: Sensory Solutions
longDescription: Our occupational therapists provide individualized sensory integration therapy for children with sensory processing disorders. We offer sensory gyms, therapeutic listening programs, and environmental modification consultations for homes and schools.

name: Behavior Bridges
longDescription: We help children with challenging behaviors develop positive alternatives through functional behavior assessment, positive behavior support plans, and skill-building interventions. Our approach focuses on understanding the function of behaviors and teaching appropriate alternatives.
